DataElement.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Largest Metastasis Diameter Centimeter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric annotation to indicate the largest diameter of lymph node metastases measured in cm.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Largest Metastasis Diameter
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the size of the largest metastatic involvement within a specimen taken from the axillary lymph nodes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Lymph nodes found in the armpit that drain the lymph channels from the breast.

Concepts.definition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.

Property.preferredDefinition: Greatest in size of those under consideration.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in size of those under consideration.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/15/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review.  --- Changed from CTEP to Alliance for by script Fri Oct 25 15:25:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A centimeter is a basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Concepts.definition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
